org.jasig.cas.adaptors.x509.authentication.handler.support

Interface CRLFetcher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LdaptiveResourceCRLFetcher, PoolingLdaptiveResourceCRLFetcher, ResourceCRLFetcher

    public interface CRLFetcher
    Defines operations needed to a fetch a CRL.
    Since:
    4.1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.security.cert.X509CRL fetch(org.springframework.core.io.Resource crl)
      Fetches a single of crl from the specified resource and returns it.
      java.util.Set<java.security.cert.X509CRL> fetch(java.util.Set<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> crls)
      Fetches a collection of crls from the specified resources and returns a map of CRLs each tracked by its url.
      java.security.cert.X509CRL fetch(java.lang.String crl)
      Fetches a single of crl from the specified resource and returns it.
      java.security.cert.X509CRL fetch(java.net.URI crl)
      Fetches a single of crl from the specified resource and returns it.
      java.security.cert.X509CRL fetch(java.net.URL crl)
      Fetches a single of crl from the specified resource and returns it.

    • Method Detail

      • fetch

        java.util.Set<java.security.cert.X509CRL> fetch(@NotNull @Size(min=1)
                                                java.util.Set<org.springframework.core.io.Resource> crls)
                                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                                java.security.cert.CRLException,
                                                java.security.cert.CertificateException
        Fetches a collection of crls from the specified resources and returns a map of CRLs each tracked by its url.
        Parameters:
        crls - resources to retrieve
        Returns:
        map of crl entries and their urls
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CRLException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - the exception thrown if resources cant be fetched
